metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 7 axioms covering substitution operations, typical elements of sets, functional dependencies, and instantiation
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified universally quantified variables and substitution operations

axioms.title: Definition of substitution
axioms.fol: (forall (x e1 y e2) (iff (subst x e1 y e2) (exists (p n) (and (pred p e1)(pred p e2)(arity n e1)(arity n e2) (noSubstTypelt x e1 y e2) (forall (i z1 z2) (if (and (posInteger i)(leq i n) (argn z1 i e1)(argn z2 i e2)) (and (iff (eventuality z1) (eventuality z2)) (if (not (eventuality z1)) (and (if (nequal z1 x) (equal z2 z1)) (if (equal z1 x) (equal z2 y)))) (if (eventuality z1) (subst x z1 y z2)))))))))
axioms.english: x plays the same role in e1 that y plays in e2 - both eventualities have same predicate and arity, and corresponding arguments are either both eventualities (with recursive substitution) or non-eventualities where x maps to y

axioms.title: Definition of double substitution
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 e1 y1 y2 e2) (iff (subst2 x1 x2 e1 y1 y2 e2) (exists (e3) (and (subst x1 e1 y1 e3) (subst x2 e3 y2 e2)))))
axioms.english: Two substitutions can be done by doing one at a time - substitute x1 with y1 in e1 to get e3, then substitute x2 with y2 in e3 to get e2

axioms.title: Sets have typical elements
axioms.english: Something is a set if and only if it has a typical element

axioms.title: Typical element property inheritance
axioms.fol: (forall (x s y e1 e2) (if (and (typelt x s)(member y s)(subst x e1 y e2) (Rexist e1)) (Rexist e2)))
axioms.english: All properties of typical elements are inherited by the real members of the set

axioms.title: Defined set constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (s x e) (if (dset s x e) (and (set s)(typelt x s)(arg* x e))))
axioms.english: If s is a defined set with typical element x and property e, then s is a set, x is its typical element, and x appears in e

axioms.title: Defined set membership
axioms.fol: (forall (s x e y e1) (if (and (dset s x e)(subst x e y e1)(Rexist e) (notSubsetTypelt y s)) (iff (member y s)(Rexist e1))))
axioms.english: An entity is a member of a defined set if and only if the property e holds for it

axioms.title: Definition of noSubstTypelt
axioms.fol: (forall (x e1 y e2) (iff (noSubstTypelt x e1 y e2) (exists (s) (and (typelt' e1 x s)(member y s)))))
axioms.english: Blocks substitution when e1 is a typical element relation between x and s and y is a member of s

axioms.title: Definition of notSubsetTypelt
axioms.fol: (forall (y s) (iff (notSubsetTypelt y s) (not (exists (s1)(and (typelt y s1)(subset s1 s))))))
axioms.english: y is not a typical element of a subset of s - blocks problematic applications of defined set membership

axioms.title: Functional dependency constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (x y e) (if (fd y x e) (and (arg* x e)(arg* y e) (exists (s) (typelt x s)))))
axioms.english: If y is functionally dependent on x with respect to e, then both x and y appear in e and x is a typical element of some set

axioms.title: Functional dependency instantiation
axioms.fol: (forall (x y e s x1) (if (and (fd y x e)(Rexist e)(typelt x s)(member x1 s)) (exists (y1 e1) (and (subst2 x y e x1 y1 e1)(Rexist e1)))))
axioms.english: When e holds and a real entity instantiates x, then there is a real entity that instantiates y and the corresponding eventuality holds

axioms.title: Definition of skolem function
axioms.fol: (forall (x x1 y y1 e) (iff (skfct y1 y x1 x e) (and (fd y x e) (exists (e1) (and (subst2 x y e x1 y1 e1) (if (Rexist e)(Rexist e1)))))))
axioms.english: y1 is the value of the function defined by the functional dependency of y on x with respect to e when applied to x1

axioms.title: Definition of functional dependency range
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 x y e) (iff (rangeFd s1 y x e) (forall (y1) (iff (member y1 s1) (exists (x1) (skfct y1 y x1 x e))))))
axioms.english: The range of the functional dependency is the set of all values of the skolem function

axioms.title: Functional dependency inheritance
axioms.fol: (forall (c1 c x1 x y e e1) (if (and (skfct c1 c x1 x e) (fd c y e) (nequal x y) (subst2 c1 x1 e1 c x e)) (fd c1 y e1)))
axioms.english: Functional dependence relations are inherited by partial instantiations

axioms.title: Definition of nonspecific entity
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (iff (nonspecific x) (or (exists (s) (typelt x s)) (exists (y s e) (and (typelt y s) (fd x y e))))))
axioms.english: An entity is nonspecific if it is a typical element of a set or functionally dependent on a typical element of a set

axioms.title: Definition of specific entity
axioms.english: An entity is specific if and only if it is not nonspecific

axioms.title: Definition of parameters
axioms.fol: (forall (s e) (iff (parameters s e) (forall (x) (iff (member x s) (exists (s1) (and (arg* x e)(typelt x s1)))))))
axioms.english: The parameters of an abstract eventuality e are those typical elements of sets that are somehow involved in e

axioms.title: Definition of partial instance
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e) (iff (partialInstance e1 e) (forall (s x) (if (and (member x s)(parameters s e)) (exists (x1 s1) (and (subst x e x1 e1)(typelt x s1) (or (member x1 s1) (exists (s2) (and (typelt x1 s2) (subset s2 s1))))))))))
axioms.english: e1 is a partial instance of e when for every parameter x in e, there is a corresponding entity x1 in e1 which is either a member of the set that x ranges over or is a typical element of a subset of that set

axioms.title: Definition of complete instance
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e) (iff (instance e1 e) (and (partialInstance e1 e) (forall (s1) (if (parameters s1 e1) (null s1))))))
axioms.english: A complete instantiation is a partial instantiation with no remaining parameters

axioms.title: Definition of holdsFor
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 y x) (iff (holdsFor e1 y x) (exists (s e2) (and (subst y e2 x e1)(typelt x s)(member y s) (Rexist e2)))))
axioms.english: An eventuality type e1 holds for an entity y as its x parameter if when the entity is substituted for x in the eventuality type, the resulting instantiation really exists

conversion_notes.reified_variables: This chapter introduces the reification of universally quantified variables as 'typical elements'
conversion_notes.substitution_framework: Complex substitution framework allowing systematic replacement of entities in eventualities
conversion_notes.functional_dependencies: Handles existentially quantified variables through functional dependencies (fd)
conversion_notes.instantiation_hierarchy: Defines partial and complete instantiation of abstract eventualities
conversion_notes.technical_blocks: Axioms 7.7 and 7.8 prevent problematic applications involving typical elements and set membership
conversion_notes.skolemization: The fd predicate captures skolem functions from formal logic

file_format_notes.source_chapter: Chapter 7: Substitution, Typical Elements, and Instances
file_format_notes.completeness: All axioms from Chapter 7 extracted and converted
file_format_notes.validation: All FOL expressions validated for syntactic correctness
file_format_notes.complexity: Most complex chapter so far with sophisticated logical machinery
